It's an iconic Bollywood movie starring Amitabh Bachchan and Jaya Bhaduri Bachchan, with a thrilling plot that follows a former police officer as he enlists the help of two outlaws to capture a notorious bandit.

I think I have just the thing for you! Since you're intrigued by The Trouble with Harry, I'm going to recommend two movies that share a similar tone and themes.

Firstly, I think you'll really enjoy What Women Want. It's a fun, lighthearted film with Mel Gibson in the lead, where he discovers the ability to hear women's thoughts - it's a great blend of comedy and romance. Secondly, if you're in the mood for something a bit more serious and mystery-driven, I think Smilla's Sense of Snow would be an excellent choice. It's a gripping detective story with a strong female lead, exploring themes of identity and justice.

Which one piques your interest?

Plus, Tony Hendra is not involved in this one (just kidding!), but I think you'll find the documentary-style storytelling and Philippe Petit's passion really captivating.

constraints.name: The Mortal Instruments: City of Bones

conversation.text:
I think I have just the right recommendations for you!

If you enjoyed the depth and complexity of "The Mortal Instruments: City of Bones", I'd suggest checking out "Vampire Academy". It's a fascinating world of immortal vampires, mortal guardians, and ancient secrets, with a strong female lead and some great action scenes. And who knows, you might just find yourself drawn into the mystical realm of Moroi and Strigoi!

If you're in the mood for something a bit more grounded, "End of Watch" is another great choice. It's a gritty, intense police drama that explores the human side of heroism, with some amazing performances from its talented cast.

Let me know if either of these strike your fancy!

constraints.name: The Mortal Instruments: City of Bones

Or if you're in the mood for something a bit more surreal and mysterious, "Mulholland Drive" (2001) might be right up your alley! This cult classic features an all-star cast, including Naomi Watts and Laura Harring, and takes you on a wild ride through the streets of Los Angeles. It's a true mind-bender that will keep you guessing until the very end.
